data.title: ‘I Like Girls,’ ‘Louise en Hiver’ Wins Top Prizes at Ottawa
data.text:
The Ottawa International Animation Festival announced its 2016 winners last night at an award ceremony held at the Saint Brigid’s Center for the Arts.

The grand prize for short film was a shocker to many attendees: Diane Obomsawin’s new NFB short J’aime Les Filles (I Like Girls). The simplistic film, a short series of vignettes about women recounting their first memories of homosexual desire, wasn’t particularly notable artistically or narratively, yet managed to come out on top.

“We were delighted by the charming coming of age tales, told from different perspectives,” said the short jury members–Ann Marie Fleming (Canada), Brooke Keesling (USA), and Sarina Nihei (Japan). “Fresh, funny, sweet. The vignettes were strong. The design and colors were excellent. Simple, lovely animation.”

The top feature prize was awarded to Jean-François Laguionie’s Louise en hiver. The feature jury was comprised of Giannalberto Bendazzi (Italy), Peter Millard (UK), and Elise Simard (Canada).

A complete list of Ottawa’s 2016 winners is below:

OTTAWA 2016 AWARDS

Nelvana Grand Prize for Independent Short Animation

J’aime Les Filles (I Like Girls)

Diane Obomsawin (Canada, 2016)

Grand Prize for Best Animated Feature

Louise en hiver

Jean-François Laguionie (France/Canada, 2016)

CATEGORY AWARDS

Cartoon Network Award for Best Narrative Short Animation

Blind Vaysha

Theodore Ushev (Canada, 2016)

Award for Best Experimental or Abstract Animation

Datum Point

Ryo Orikasa (Japan, 2015)

Award for Best Undergraduate Animation

Foreign Body

Marta Magnuska (Poland, 2016)

Walt Disney Animation Award for Best Graduation Animation

Frankfurter Str. 99

Evgenia Gostrer (Germany, 2016)

Award for Best Commissioned Animation

Honda “Paper”

Pes (USA, 2015)

Award for Best Short Film Made for Young Audiences

Three Little Ninjas Delivery Service

Karim Rhellam, Kim Claeys (Belgium, 2016)

Award for Best Short Film Made for Young Audiences (Honorable Mentions)

Accidents, Blunder and Calamities

James Cunningham (New Zealand)

Novembre

Marjolaine Perreten (France)

Award for Best Animated Series Made for Young Audiences

Shaun the Sheep “The Farmer’s Llamas”

Jay Grace (UK, 2015)

Award for Best Animated Series Made for Young Audiences (Honorable Mentions)

Summer Camp Island

Julia Pott (USA)

Hey Duggee “The Omelette Badge”

Grant Orchard (UK)

CRAFT AWARDS

Award for Best Script

Fired on Mars

Nick Vokey, Nate Sherman (USA, 2016)

Award for Best Design

The Absence of Eddy Table

Rune Spaans (Norway, 2016)

Award for Best Animation Technique

Velodrool

Sander Joon (Estonia, 2015)

Award for Best Sound

Squame

Nicolas Brault (Canada, 2015)

OTHER AWARDS

DHX Public Prize

Fired on Mars

Nick Vokey, Nate Sherman (USA, 2016)

Canadian Film Institute Award for Best Canadian Animation

Blind Vaysha

Theodore Ushev (Canada, 2016)

Canadian Film Institute Award for Best Canadian Animation (Honorable Mentions)

4min15 au révélateur

Moia Jobin-Paré

Begone Dull Care

Paul Johnson

VIA Rail Award for Best Canadian Student Animation

Nihil

Khoebe Magsaysay (Sheridan College, 2016)

VIA Rail Award for Best Canadian Student Animation (Honorable Mentions)
